data: Funerary inscription to Olos Papios Agatharchos
I.Sicily with the permission of the Assessorato Regionale dei Beni Culturali e dell’Identità Siciliana - Dipartimento dei Beni Culturali e dell’Identità Siciliana
funerary inscription to olos papios agatharchos
ISic001150. Funerary inscription to Olos Papios Agatharchos

Facsimile Images

Ὦλε Πάπ̣ιε
Ἀγάθαρχε
χαῖρε

Apparatus criticus

Text from autopsy; The damage to the top right of line 1, might be reconstructed as pi, or tau (with a short crossbar) followed by another letter (perhaps iota). That the final two letters were iota and epsilon is recorded in IG as extant on the stone.

English translation

Olos Papios Agatharchos, farewell.

commentary

The praenomen Olos, derived from the Latin Aulus, is attested elsewhere epigraphically (but not in Sicily). If the restoration is correct, Papios is the first epigraphic instance of the transcription of Papius into Greek. Agatharcos is a common Greek name. Korhonen notes that this inscription was never transported and sent back from Rome, as recorded in IG (with bibliography).
